StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateMapsRecruiterZip]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@RecruiterZipId uniqueidentifier, @Recrui.ngPersonId uniqueidentifier, @Zip varchar(5)=null, --@LastUpdateDate date.me, @LastUpdateUserId uniqueidentifier
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT RecruiterZipId FROM MapsRecruiterZip WHERE RecruiterZipId = @RecruiterZipId) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Employee already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE MapsRecruiterZip SET Recrui.ngPersonId=@Recrui.ngPersonId, Zip=@Zip, LastUpdateDate=GETDATE(), LastUpdateUserId=@LastUpdateUserId WHERE RecruiterZipId = @RecruiterZipId END ELSE BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Employee does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO MapsRecruiterZip (RecruiterZipId, Recrui.ngPersonId, Zip, LastUpdateDate, LastUpdateUserId) VALUES (@RecruiterZipId, @Recrui.ngPersonId, @Zip, GETDATE(), @LastUpdateUserId) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
